text: ```Atlantis is a legendary island first mentioned by the ancient Greek philosopher Plato in his dialogues "Timaeus" and "Critias." The story of Atlantis has captivated the imaginations of people for centuries, sparking debates, theories, and even expeditions in search of the lost civilization.

text: According to Plato, Atlantis was a powerful and advanced civilization that existed around 9,000 years before his time, which would place its existence around 11,000 years ago.

text: According to Plato, Atlantis was a large island located beyond the "Pillars of Hercules," which are believed to be the modern-day Strait of Gibraltar.

entity3.name: Pillars of Hercules

entity4.name: Strait of Gibraltar
entity4.description: A narrow strait that connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea and separates Spain from Morocco.

text: The island was said to be rich in resources and possessed advanced technology and military power.

text: The Atlanteans were described as a noble and virtuous people who eventually became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall.

entity1.description: A group of people described as initially noble and virtuous, but who later became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall.

text: The most famous aspect of the Atlantis legend is its sudden and catastrophic destruction.

entity1.name: Atlantis
entity1.description: A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, known for its sudden and catastrophic destruction.

text: Plato describes how Atlantis was swallowed by the sea in a single day and night, disappearing beneath the waves and leaving no trace behind.

text: This cataclysmic event has captured the imagination of many, leading to theories about what could have caused such a dramatic event.
